channel.title: Help switching to Ubuntu 6.06
channel.description: Hey, currently i have suselinux 10.1 installed and i want to switch to Ubuntu 6.06. how do i do this? do i just delete the partitions? or would that screw up my booting?

item.title: Help switching to Ubuntu 6.06
item.dc:creator: @ghostboy195 ghostboy195
item.description:
@ghostboy195 wrote:

but wouldn't that mess up my boot loader that's installed on the MBR?

EDIT: Just answered my own question there lol :rolleyes: i think...

Read full topic

item.title: Help switching to Ubuntu 6.06
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

Well you can delete the suselinux partition, but everything will be deleted in there, I hope you know that. I would do that though.

Next, popin the Ubuntu Linux CD, and look at the instructions very closely. While installing there should be an option to create a partition. I missed that on my computer and ended up deleting WIndows XP off my computer and man oh man I was pissed. So don't miss that option!!!

~Ron

Read full topic
